body:
> acceleration (instead of constant speed from launch to impact)

Starting with low speed and gradually become faster, rather than flying at constant speed.

I'll play around with the acceleration next. I guess that that would mean 
- an additional upper speed limit will be needed
- too high speeds might adversely affect accuracy
- testing how it'd work with the freefall mode

Sorry, I took only a quick glampse so far.

What is freefall mode you refer to? Does that apply to missiles which already passed their RangeLimit but has ExplodeWhenEmpty=false and refers that they fall to the ground without doing(?) damage?

Does ActivationDelay means RA2 CourseLockDuration - missile is forced into the initial facing for x frames and only then starts to guide itself to target?

@GraionDilach, you have understood the `RangeLimit` and `ExplodeWhenEmpty == false` correctly. But the missile explodes when it touches ground ultimately.

The `ActivationDelay` also uses freefall (not constant velocity) before the guiding starts. This means that the missile does not just travel in a given direction, but that it follows a ballistic trajectory. You would want to use the `LaunchAngle` and `InitialSpeed` here.
OK, updated. The TODO comments will be taken care of when the YAML upgrade rule is in place.
`OpenRA.Mods.Common/Effects/Missile.cs(382,36): error CS0103: The name "shadowPos" does not exist in the current context`
I've removed the missile shadow part cause it's done in #8923

Gave this some ingame testing, works nice for the most part!

One thing I noticed, though: increasing the `AirburstAltitude` does not only increase the altitude above, but also distance from target the explosion will happen. With a TS Nod bazooka, an `AirburstAltitude` value of `1024` made the missile explode after little more than half the maximum distance (and `RangeLimit` was disabled, so that can't be the problem).

:+1: from me after that is adressed.

Bump.
@matija-hustic you still around?

@penev Yep, just without my computer for another ten days. I'll get to the
PRs as soon as I can. But all of the requested changes are minor if I
recall correctly
Em 20/08/2015 10:53, "Pavel Penev" notifications@github.com escreveu:

> Bump.
> @matija-hustic https://github.com/matija-hustic you still around?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8717#issuecomment-132959053.
Any progress?
@matija-hustic if you're still around, can you give an estimation when you'll be able to update and rebase this?
Ah OK! That should then be very easy to do. I'll get to it today.

How about now @reaperrr? The missile now aims at exactly what you said, but I've left the condition that it explodes when in that airburst cylinder (if you e.g. launch a missile from a bazooka and it has a low VROT, then the missile wouldn't have to spiral upwards to reach the exact airburst altitude, but can explode even if it's under that altitude). Or should I just remove that condition?

Yes, this is what I meant. Works like in TS now.
Unless someone else says otherwise, I think that condition is fine.

The rest already worked fine before, so :+1:

>  they'd fly towards and (visually at least, the damage was still dealt to the ground but that's out of this PR's scope) explode at targetpos.Z + AirburstAltitude (original TS used some magic hardcoded number of cells above ground, I think).

No, the airburst delivered the damage where it exploded. The second stages are out of this PR's scope though. I'll check the code tomorrow.
Now the upgrade rule is in there, too, as well as the changed yamls it yields

Last changes and upgrade rules look good, but it would be nice if you could make the title and description of the main commit more informative.

Calling it "Missile projectile refactor" and then copy-pasting the list of changes from the PR description would be enough.
Done

This looks good pretty much overall, however the current setup disallows TS rockets to fire up a cliff - Rocket Infantry can't even fire down if it doesn't stand at the edge.

The cause of that is the low `CruiseAltitude`, the default works on flat terrain, but since a cliff is 4 cell (2048 wu) high in TS the altitude cannot adapt to such a sudden jump immediately. 2048 works nicely with `VerticalROT` 10 on the Rocket Infantry, without being such prevalent jumpiness as your old gif.

I just assume though that HorizontalROT = VerticalROT in TS looks the best.

:+1: when CruiseAltitude and VerticalROT are upped in the TS weapons.
In the longer term the missiles will need to probe the ground a few ticks-worth of travel ahead, and start to climb early if there is a sudden change.
Note that we have lookup-table based trig functions, so they aren't going to be particularly expensive.

The last change(s) regressed the flight behavior, in my opinion. The missile now sometimes climbs up 100% vertically, which looks very weird, and on flat terrain against targets the missile "in range" check now seems to trigger very late, leading to a very sudden and steep descend towards the target.

> This looks good pretty much overall, however the current setup disallows TS rockets to fire up a cliff - Rocket Infantry can't even fire down if it doesn't stand at the edge.

In my opinion this should be solved by tweaking LaunchAngle and CruiseAltitude instead. I don't like the side-effects the latest revision has introduced.

Ok, after some more testing it's not as bad as I thought at first.

However, that check for height triggers even if the targeted cell is just close to, but not on top of the cliff. This makes the missile fly like this when targeting a cell close to a cliff: _|\ even if the target is on the same level as the shooter.
@reaperrr, do I close this?
Unless you'd like to take it over again this can be closed, yes.

Well I have a new version of the lookahead. When I test it, it avoids almost all obstacles (when physically possible) even without increasing VROT. Plus it tries decelerating to get the vertical turn radius smaller and the missile more easily manoeuvrable.

I might have made it too complex tho... I can push it to this PR so you guys can see if it's something that'd be desired or not
